title: Ambridge school board approves superintendent's sick leave, assistant's resignation
text:
Ambridge school board approves superintendent's sick leave, assistant's resignation By Katherine Schaeffer kschaeffer@timesonline.com Timesonline.com | 0 comments 
The Ambridge Area School Board approved eight months of sick leave for Superintendent Cynthia Zurchin at Monday’s board meeting. 
The board approved former Ambridge Superintendent Joseph Dimperio to serve as substitute superintendent during Zurchin's absence for a rate of $490 per day, with no benefits, effective Oct. 15. 
The board voted 7-1 to approve Zurchin's sick leave effective Oct. 13, 2015 through June 30, 2016, although the reason for her sick leave was not made public. 
The board also voted to accept Assistant Superintendent Megan Mealie’s resignation, effective Oct. 30. Mealie was suspended with pay in March pending the results of an internal investigation. 
Several community members, including Mealie’s mother Charlene Geffel and sisters Terry Mylan and Laura Nichi, spoke on Mealie’s behalf during public comment. Each of the community members spoke of Mealie’s passion for the district and its children, expressing disbelief at her suspension and resignation. 
“It’s when we stop caring that things are going to fall down,” said Mylan, who is running for school board this fall. “Megan never stopped caring even though there were problems. She continued to fight.” 
Board president Jeremy Angus could not comment on the specific personnel issues surrounding Zurchin’s sick leave and Mealie’s resignation. The board is actively working to come up with the next steps it will take, he said.
